intro: Pellionia goepeliana, commonly known as the silver mohair plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its dense, silvery-white foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Pellionia goepeliana is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and is relatively easy to care for in indoor settings.
